intro: Caesia occidentalis, commonly known as the western caesia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are small and white or pale blue in color. Caesia occidentalis is often found in areas with well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
